arm_group.description: Daily supplementation with NutraStem Active; 2 capsules per day for 28 days
Daily supplementation with placebo; 2 capsules per day for 28 days

brief_summary.textblock:
Compare an over-the-counter dietary supplement (NutraStem Active®) and placebo over a 30-day
      intervention on aerobic exercise performance and fatigue.

      The hypothesis is that supplementation with NutraStem Active® improve aerobic performance
      and reduce subjective measures of fatigue.

clinical_study.brief_title: Impact of Nutritional Supplementation on Aerobic Performance and Fatigue

detailed_description.textblock:
Compare an over-the-counter dietary supplement (NutraStem Active®) and placebo over a 30-day
      intervention on aerobic exercise performance and fatigue.

      The hypothesis is that supplementation with NutraStem Active® improve aerobic performance
      and reduce subjective measures of fatigue.

      The basic protocol includes baseline assessment of fitness and participation in a vigorous
      session of exercise immediately before and 30 days after consumption of the experimental
      supplement or placebo.

      The exercise task is intended to be fatiguing and demanding but is not expected to create
      failure.

      The supplement makes claims related to boosting exercise performance and reducing fatigue.

      The study design will determine if these outcomes are in fact present in a group of healthy,
      young, and active adults.

      The primary dependent measures are perceived exertion during exercise and levels of fatigue
      measured on multiple non-exercise days.

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:

          -  healthy

          -  physically active

          -  non-smoker

        Exclusion Criteria:

          -  known cardiovascular, pulmonary, or metabolic disease

          -  body mass index greater than 35

clinical_study.official_title: Impact of Nutritional Supplementation on Aerobic Performance and Fatigue

oversight_info.authority: United States: Food and Drug Administration

primary_outcome.description: Psychophysiological response to vigorous aerobic exercise.

required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on June 04, 2014
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

secondary_outcome.description: Perceived level of fatigue as assessed in the first hours after waking.

clinical_study.study_design: Allocation: Randomized, Endpoint Classification: Safety/Efficacy Study, Intervention Model: Parallel Assignment, Masking: Double Blind (Subject, Investigator), Primary Purpose: Basic Science
